messages.content:
You are tasked with adding English translations to a set of stakeholder quotes. For each quote:
- If the quote is in English, add "N.A." as the translation
- If the quote is in any other language, provide an accurate English translation

Input format is a markdown table with stakeholder names and quotes.
Output should be a markdown table with three columns: name, original quote, and translation.

IMPORTANT RULES:
- Never translate English quotes to English - use "N.A." instead.
- Only and always translate non-English quotes.
- If the original quote, in the third column of the md table is not in english, translate it and add the translation in the 4th column, as described below, but that is only when the quote is not in English.
- Keep original quotes exactly as they are.
- Maintain the markdown table format, without including any horizontal divider lines

Example input:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." |

Example output:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." | "This decision is important." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." | N.A. |

Example input:
| [Person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,eyc..)] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] |

Example output:
| [person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,etc..)] | [Translated Quote] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] | N.A. |

If the input is "None", return "None". if the original quote is not in English, make sure it is translated. Add "N.A" if the quote is already in English.

Input quotes:
| Andrew Forrest | Fortescue's Executive Chairman | "this is probably the politically correct answer I need to give" |
| Dino Otranto | Fortescue's CEO | "this is probably the politically correct answer I need to give" |
| Shelley Robertson | Fortescue's Chief Operating Officer | "Can someone explain the org structure? We have CEOs reporting to CEOs, directors to directors, and varying titles, despite being told it would be 'flattened'." |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Most of us can't afford a nice bottle of scotch." |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Why is the budget so tight at the minute? Are we expected to deliver world class service on a shoestring budget?" |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Is there an opportunity in the future to expand on the CEO for a day initiative and participate if you are not a First Nations -employee?" |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Instead of a Christmas party, can you give each department $150 per person to hold their own team party?" |
| Spokeswoman | Not mentioned | "This is just one avenue we are using to ensure our staff can continue to engage and interact with the leadership team, getting answers to the topics that matter the most to our people." |

| Andrew Forrest | Fortescue's Executive Chairman | "this is probably the politically correct answer I need to give" | N.A. |
| Dino Otranto | Fortescue's CEO | "this is probably the politically correct answer I need to give" | N.A. |
| Shelley Robertson | Fortescue's Chief Operating Officer | "Can someone explain the org structure? We have CEOs reporting to CEOs, directors to directors, and varying titles, despite being told it would be 'flattened'." | N.A. |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Most of us can't afford a nice bottle of scotch." | N.A. |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Why is the budget so tight at the minute? Are we expected to deliver world class service on a shoestring budget?" | N.A. |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Is there an opportunity in the future to expand on the CEO for a day initiative and participate if you are not a First Nations -employee?" | N.A. |
| Fortescue Employee | Employee | "Instead of a Christmas party, can you give each department $150 per person to hold their own team party?" | N.A. |
| Spokeswoman | Not mentioned | "This is just one avenue we are using to ensure our staff can continue to engage and interact with the leadership team, getting answers to the topics that matter the most to our people." | N.A. |
